values:
There is, yes, a new HP trailer for Half Blood Prince.

http://www.apple.com/trailers/wb/harrypotterandthehalfbloodprince/

This looks MUCH better than the poo that was OoTP.  

Thoughts?

I've been playing with my new camera and while I freely admit that I know ABSOLUTELY NOTHING about still cameras, the bare rudiments of composition and almost nothing about lighting, I'm still pretty happy with the way some of these came out.  I've been futzing with a couple in iPhoto and I look forward to taking more and learning more about how my camera works and how photography overall works.  I think it'll make me even better at my job when filming and will definitely be a nice outlet creatively.  

http://www.flickr.com/photos/10036305@N08/


Also, we went to see "In the Heights" and it was absolutely incredible.  I cannot recommend it enough to everyone.  Not that they really need your money because they're doing quite well, but go see it!  Go!  At once!

We're back from Jamaica.  Other than their complete disbelief in either vegetarianism (at one meal, Amy was served semi-soft carrots and cauliflower) or homosexuality (drink every time you get asked if you're sisters... we counted six), it was a great time.  We did... NOTHING.  Absolutely nothing.  Except go down waterslides and drink lots of "dark and stormys".  I discovered the joy of Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee (yes, after giving up soda, in the same breath, I took up coffee).  We brought back rum and coffee and (Amy at least) sunburns to remember our trip.  She also posted photos on flickr, here: http://www.flickr.com/photos/amymlitt/sets/72157616219719003/
and on facebook.

In other news, I applied to a graduate program at Columbia's Teachers College (an M.A. in Communication in Education) and I'm waiting to hear back from them now.  I also just purchased a Canon Rebel XT because I have a shitty digital camera that takes worse pictures than my phone does and after taking some photos with Amy's camera, I am resolved to become an enthusiastic hobbyist... or at least take fun pictures of my friends at the bar.  So, ummm, for now, that's it.  Off to a polenta breakfast!

I still exist... really, I do.  I've been working like crazy, working out like crazy, lost ten pounds and I'm going to Jamaica Sunday.  I promise to start updating more often, for those of you who care.  I still love you all and I show far more love to my Facebook because I can access it from my phone.

So, the soda thing is going pretty well... I've been down to about a glass a week and it doesn't taste as satisfying as it did before.  I also noticed (well, Amy noticed) that the raccoon bags under my eyes disappear and I'm generally much less puffy without soda.  

For the last five days, I've been eating big salads at lunch and going to the gym for about 30 minutes a day-- alternating between swimming, interval running and interval stationary bikes-- with a bit of weight lifting.  I also took on a once a week pilates class on Tuesdays for the intersession at school.  Amy and I are going to a yoga class on Monday downtown that's free.

I plan on rewarding myself by eating whatever the hell I want on weekends and not really worrying about exercising then.  After only one week I already feel trimmer, healthier and more even in my temperament.  My plans are to keep this up through the month of January and see how I feel and how far it takes me and then proceed from there.  I think I will enjoy a daily workout regimen and even if I don't always eat salads at work, I need to consciously consume many more vegetables and fruits and I feel that that will evolve naturally from this process.

My father, in a staggering moment of actually listening to me, got me exactly what I wanted for Christmas-- the George Foreman Next Grilleration with swappable plates.  In the three days since it came into my possession, I've used it to make several arugula, tomato and mozzarella panini and now, vegan apple cider waffles.  All the plates are dishwasher safe and this one also came with a bonus: omelette plates, so I no longer have to admit that I can't flip an omelette to save my life.  Instead, I can make small individually sized omelettes with a whisk and a pour.

This is the best toy ever.  I highly recommend it.  I soon plan on grilling some thin cut chicken breasts to chop up and put in the arugula to make myself salads with for work.  Unfortunately, the George Foreman is not sophisticated enough to go to the grocery store for me and buy these things, so that errand will have to wait until I have pants on.

I'll write a more contemplative post later about the year.  Right now, I bought myself Guitar Hero World Tour and I'm too busy beating my drums.

BEAT DRUMS!  BEAT DRUMS!


Oh yeah... happy new years.  :)

So today is the 500th day of me quitting smoking.  It actually doesn't bother me so much that I keep active track of it, but I keep a widget on my desktop that tells me so.  It's a good way of giving me a sense of passive achievement.

I quit drinking regular soda a while ago because I figured I didn't need the tons of extra calories.  So I switched to diet.  I have a bitching caffeine/sugar addiction.  However, I haven't really lost any weight at all switching to diet soda.  I figured that some of it had to do with the quitting smoking, slower metabolism and all that...  I also figured that my only real sacrifice would be in dental health, and that was low on my priority list...

Then I read this....

http://www.nytimes.com/2008/02/05/health/nutrition/05symp.html?ref=health

and realized that a lot of the abdominal fat I'm trying to shed is probably related.  So, I've decided, slightly grudgingly, that my next big life change is to give up/drastically reduce my soda intake (currently rated at a LOT daily).

More than with cigarettes or anything else, I dread the withdrawal.  I figured I could switch to coffee... since I've started drinking that lately too... but I normally take it with two sugar packets.

Does anyone know anything about this?  Would switching exclusively to coffee with sugar help eliminate the abdominal fat (assuming that I exercise 2-3 times a week currently regardless of other factors)?  Is it just a bloating thing too?  Would the real sugar in the coffee offset the benefit of the fake sugar in the diet soda?  Do I just need to start drinking black coffee and eliminate all the sugar?

Thoughts?  Opinions?

Bacon does not, in fact, make everything better.  One of the things it does not improve is my prized weekend garlic bagel with scallion cream cheese.  Why the lady making my bagel felt compelled to use the bacon scallion cream cheese instead, or, in fact, why the bacon scallion cream cheese exists, eludes me.  The bacony salt overwhelms the scalliony goodness and it throws off the balance of my delicious "I like my coworkers so I don't order this at Nussbaum & Wu's" treat.

Dammit, bagel lady.

I'm going to steal something a friend of mine (Reggie) wrote about today... and why I'm still having trouble not crying at my desk from joy...


It is difficult, in this world, to believe in something.
We'd all have a much easier time being cynical, expecting the worst, criticisizing others.

Our whole lives we've been told
that this day would never come.
There would be an American president
who is Black
who is mixed
who is from an immigrant family
who has a Muslim name
who spent part of his youth in another country
who was raised by a single mother and her mother
who's wife and children look and sound like his do
who worked in the City as a community organizer
who believes that cooperation with every corner the world is the best way to lead
who believes that our role as a beacon of hope is the best way to shield us from harm
who believes that we are only as strong as the weakest among us

And... here we are in heaven.

Barack Hussein Obama appealed to our better angels
He asked us to be better than that
He never expected us to be petty
or worried that we were too shell shocked by 9/11 to accept change
or feared that we couldn't handle the journey into the future. 

He knew who America really was.

America is why Rosa sat
Martin marched
and why Barack ran
so our children will fly.

I may be young
but I've never been so proud to be American.

Lately, I've been making a lot more vegetarian food.  Gradually, I'm becoming more comfortable with this, because it's very fun to feed tasty things to my girlfriend.  Last week I did mock beef fajitas with sauteed peppers and onions and last night I did mock sausage and pepper sub sandwiches.  I was actually very surprised that the snausage-in-a-tube is quite tasty once you cook it in a little bit of oil.  I'd like to come up with a good mock meat jambalaya or some way of effectively utilizing my barbecue dry rub on some mock meat stuff.  Thoughts, oh vegetarians?

Me, I'm voting Democrat because I think baby whales are more important than baby Christians.

One friend of mine is voting Democrat because it's more important to keep thousands of death row inmates alive than it is to keep millions of fetuses around.

Another friend is voting Democrat because she'd rather kill fetuses than terrorists.

So...

:: impish grin ::

Why are YOU voting Democrat?

http://amymlitt.wordpress.com/

It's pretty awesome.  Just like her.
I am deriving an inordinate amount of pleasure creating my own ringtones for my phone.  Considering that 90% of the time, my phone is on vibrate, this is quite pointless.  But still, fun.

I am the proud owner of an iPhone now... I wish I could say my life is completely changed.  It's not.  But I feel cooler.  ;-)

Also, I have no more stepcat.  This is a very very very good thing.

It's like I can't help myself... The rules: Take a picture of yourself right now. Don't change your clothes, don't fix your hair...just take a picture. Post that picture with NO editing. Post these instructions with your picture. ">

Evie!
Originally uploaded by harker207
Er, this should work... This is my new stepkitty Evie and my out of control poofy hair.

The surest sign that I am growing up is that I just spent a ton of money on The World's Greatest Vacuum Cleaner... and haven't bought my iPhone yet.  This is a bittersweet moment.  But the iPhone won't clean up after my new kitty.
Katie made me a Kitler icon.  She's the best.

An 8" television set with video and mono audio inputs.  Used gently for two years as a poor girl's NTSC monitor.  Currently taking up space in the top of a closet.  This bout of pre-roommate cleaning has inspired me to get rid of it as it hasn't been used in about six years.  It is silly to sell it.  Does anyone want it?
I love you, pack o' mine.  May your days be full of boobies and your nights be full of, well, more boobies.  :)

My mom is looking for a good self-publishing/vanity publishing site to publish my grandparents' memoir.  There will be some photos.  Don't know how long it's going to be, but she wants only about 20 copies or so to go to immediate family and she wants it bound to last.

Thoughts?

... not now that I have surfthechannel.com

Dammit.
Today is the 1 year anniversary of me quitting smoking.  I'm striving to come up with a way to celebrate that doesn't involve irony, but methods escape me.  So instead, I'll go do laundry.
Did I loan any of you my Sims 2 installer disc?  I can't find the damned thing...

-- Still waiting to hear about dream job.  Have applied to three other jobs in the interim.  I will get something soon, I just know it.

-- Have Wii Fitted every day save one in the last ten.  I have probably lost about a pound or so (hard to tell with weight fluctuations), but I am definitely already looking more toned and fit, as well as sleeping better, feeling stronger and standing straighter.  I've also been eating a lot more fiber and drinking more water and generally feeling better about life.

-- Feeling slightly less ulcerous about my job overall, but still eager to jump ship.

-- Dad may have actually succeeded with my birthday present (my own Wii).  We'll see in about five or six days.

-- I have started a new official blog to focus exclusively on writing and what I've managed to figure out about writing as a professional reader.  I can't make commenting work on iWeb (thoughts are appreciated) but if you all wanna go check it out, that'd be awesome.  It's www.writistsblog.com.  I'll be trying to update that one at least every couple of days.

I think you all are the cat's pajamas.

Wii Fit is a whore.  

It really is.

Yesterday it asked me if I had noticed Jarrod's posture improving.  When I said I couldn't tell, it told me I should pay more attention to him.

It told him that my birthday was coming up and asked him if he'd bought me a present.

I think I'm in love with this whorish machine.

It's also shamed me into working out for 30 minutes a day every day since Monday.

I GOT THE WII FIT.  Up an hour early for work, stood in line at the Nintendo World store for forty minutes, they ran out FIVE people before me, and then a woman behind me and I went to Best Buy five blocks away and got two of the last four they had in stock.  YO MOTHERFUCKER WII (fit)!!!!!!!!!!!!

Dear friends,

    Our legally savvy and sexually libertine governor, David
Paterson, has
    opened a phone line to determine how much constituent support
there is for
    his directive that state agencies must recognize same-sex
marriages from
    other states and

countries<http://www.rhrealitycheck.org/blog/2008/05/29/new-york-honor-s
amesex-marriages-performed-outofstate
 >
    .

    All you have to do is call 518.474.8390.  Then say, "I'm calling
to support
    Gov. Paterson's directive to recognize same-sex marriages from
other states
    and countries."  Then the operator will ask you your zip code.
Then you
    give it, say thanks and hang up!

    Enjoy making your voice count in state government!


EDIT:  If everyone could be so kind as to repost this/post it as a Facebook note/what have you, it would be greatly appreciated.

78

As a 1930s husband, I am
Very Superior

Take the test!

29

As a 1930s wife, I am
Poor

Take the test!

I went ahead and ordered a Wii Fit... my birthday present from my grandparents, but they don't know it yet...  they say it won't ship til the end of July... which makes me sad... but at least I'm getting one and not paying double the cost...

EDIT: I have no impulse control.  I also bought new RAM for my computer.

Enjoy...

http://carmina.ytmnd.com/

With sound.  Work safe, if it's okay for you to pee yourself laughing at work...

That reel got me the second interview... which is Monday afternoon.  I am extremely excited.  The lady I spoke to said that she was particularly impressed by the quality of the sound work... which of course makes me warm and fuzzy.  More as it develops.  I'm really trying not to get my hopes up, but if this all works out, I will be over the moon.  And now, off to the Slipper Room for <strike>wild lesbian mudwrestling,</strike> er, a birthday party full of queers.

... Guitar Hero friggin' rules.  I know I'm late to the game on this one, but... dude.  This is awesome.  

Now, off to New Orleans... catch y'all again on Wednesday.

So, sometimes, in a fit of impulsiveness, I put down a bid on eBay for Guitar Hero 3 that will never be accepted... or at least, it hasn't in the past, because it's always been just outbid by someone else.

This time, they accepted it.

Whoops.

Guess I'm gonna have Guitar Hero in a week or so...

Hee hee.

We got everything back for our trip except about forty bucks.  And we got it all two weeks before we leave for New Orleans...  a trip that we now have money for.  I am so pleased right now.  I recommend travel insurance through Travelguard to everyone now.

I like women.  I like Joss Whedon.  I like "Firefly".  This woman's post, however, I do not like.  I will not expend the energy to correct her in her wrongness, because "feminists" of this bent never listen to reason... and they have no sense of humor anyway.  Still, I want you all to read it and be particularly shocked at the number of people that think she's right or say "wow, I never thought of it that way".  One person's insanity I guess I could cope with... but the stupidity en masse and lack of acceptance of genre convention bewilders me...

http://users.livejournal.com/_allecto_/34718.html


P.S.- Thanks to Mer for not only finding this, but for posting it with the best subject ever:

"You CAN take the sky away from a woman..."

Amy and I will be in New Orleans for the first weekend of Jazz Fest at the end of this month.  Who else is getting drunk and bouncing around to Cowboy Mouth with us?  I swear, I have an alligator pie with your name on it if you're there.  :)


Note: This and Los Angeles are probably gonna be my last vacations til Christmas.  Whee!

Oh yes.  

I just scored a pair of tickets to Patrick Stewart's Macbeth for this Thursday for me and my honey.  She finds my overwhelming excitement about this somewhat off-putting. 

In the meantime, I will cry havoc and let slip the starship Enterprise.

Yes, you are all permitted to be jealous.

Also, FYI to everyone on the westerly coast.  

I'll be in Los Angeles over Memorial Day weekend.  Anyone interested in coming down?  :)

So my newest romance novel is about eleven "gods of the night" who are summoned back to the world after an absence of sixty five million years, to battle the gods of evil... at the end of the Mayan calendar (yeah, that's right). And they get reincarnated (of course) in the forms of studly human men. When they fight, they can manifest the essences of the forms they had when they were incarnated last...

Now... what was around sixty five million years ago?

And why is my studly male protagonist's name Ty?

AND WHY AM I SUPPOSED TO FIND THE IDEA OF A DINOSAUR TRAPPED IN A MAN'S BODY SEXY?!

I never thought I'd feel that vampires and werewolves were so normal and reasonable.

Seriously people, wtf. And why aren't we getting published?

I'm not sure what was best... being the last one on my losing team to get shot out of the game or holding my own, albeit briefly, with one of New York's Finest, while wearing a loud red sweater that was seemingly impervious to fire, but I can totally check this off my list, and say I want to go again...

#65--  Paintball!
I am very close to writing a list of rules for trashy police procedurals/serial killer books.  Once I'm done with the two I got in this batch, I may have to do it, just to cleanse my head.
Scrabulous has eaten my life.  And Amy's.  It's too late for us.  Save yourselves.

#5-- Visit at least two countries I haven't been to-- now three!  Switzerland, Jamaica and the Cayman Islands!
#70-- Go to the Caribbean
#97-- Go on a cruise
